name: SCNView
desc: A view for displaying 3D SceneKit content.

items.name: init(frame: CGRect, options: [String : Any]?)
items.desc: Initializes and returns a newly allocated SceneKit view object with the specified frame rectangle and options.

items.name: struct SCNView.Option
items.desc: Dictionary keys specifying initialization options, used when initializing a SceneKit view.

items.name: var scene: SCNScene?
items.desc: The scene to be displayed in the view.

items.name: var backgroundColor: NSColor
items.desc: The background color of the view.

items.name: var preferredFramesPerSecond: Int
items.desc: The animation frame rate that the view uses to render its scene.

items.name: var rendersContinuously: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value that determines whether the view always renders at its preferred frame rate or only when its visible content changes.

items.name: var antialiasingMode: SCNAntialiasingMode
items.desc: The antialiasing mode used for rendering the view’s scene.

items.name: enum SCNAntialiasingMode
items.desc: Modes for antialiased rendering of the view’s scene, used by the SCNView property.

items.name: var allowsCameraControl: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value that determines whether the user can manipulate the current point of view that is used to render the scene.

items.name: var cameraControlConfiguration: SCNCameraControlConfiguration
items.desc: The current configuration for the camera controller's event-handling behavior.

items.name: protocol SCNCameraControlConfiguration
items.desc: Properties affecting the behavior of a camera controller.

items.name: func pause(Any?)
items.desc: Pauses playback of the view’s scene.

items.name: func play(Any?)
items.desc: Resumes playback of the view’s scene.

items.name: func stop(Any?)
items.desc: Stops playback of the view’s scene and resets the scene time to its start time.

items.name: func snapshot() -> UIImage
items.desc: Renders the view’s scene into a new image object.
